alert.note: Alert for Anson; Montgomery; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 8:52PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Anson, southwestern Montgomery and Stanly Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 852 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mt Pleasant, or 10 miles west of Albemarle, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Ansonville, Plyler, Locust, Norwood, Oakboro, Stanfield, Mount Gilead, Uwharrie Haven and Finger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
